alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 06 at 5:15PM MST until February 07 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches below 7500 feet with higher amounts of 2 to 6 inches above 7500 feet. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Southwest Mountains, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, South Central Mountains, and San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 6 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains
